intro: Quisqueya fuertesii, commonly known as the Fuertesii Quisqueya, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
